title: Croatia midfielder Ivan Rakitic could leave Barcelona for Inter Milan or Manchester United transfer
text:
Manchester United have entered talks with Barcelona over a deal for Ivan Rakitic, according to reports in Spain linking the out-of-favour midfielder with a move to Old Trafford or rival suitors Inter Milan.

Rakitic has been a peripheral figure for the Spanish giants so far this season, starting just once and playing little more than three hours of football in all competitions.

The Liga champions want at least £34million for the 31-year-old as part of a bid to balance their books to the tune of £110million, according to Sport.

Ivan Rakitic has discussed ending his five-year spell with Barcelona having falling out of favour

Barcelona coach Ernesto Valverde has handed the midfielder a solitary start so far this season

Rakitic wants to stay at Barcelona but has admitted he is frustrated at spending more time enjoying the city than on the pitch, having made almost 200 appearances since switching from Sevilla five years ago.

'I need to play and not just enjoy walks around the city and the beach,' Rakitic told 24sata, revealing he missed Croatia's European Qualifying matches in September because 'the situation at my club wasn't right.'

'I don’t know what will come now. It's tough because I want to play and not just be part of the team.

'I want to fight so that the team see me ready to deliver on the pitch. I will do everything possible to change my situation.

Manchester United boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has been linked with a move for Croatia's Rakitic

The 31-year-old Champions League winner helped his country reach the 2018 World Cup final

'I have two years left on my deal and there's no better place to play than Barcelona, the best club in the world.'

Rakitic has praised the club's fans for showing him 'affection' but warned that his continuing time on the bench could force him to 'talk about my situation again' with Barca.

The holder of more than 100 caps played for 74 minutes as Croatia beat Hungary 3-0 in Euro 2020 qualifying on Thursday to remain top of Group E.
description: Rakitic has voiced his frustration after been a peripheral figure for the Spanish giants so far this season, starting just once and playing little more than three hours of football in all competitions.
